content.raw:
Following your investigations, I would say that there is potential risk of generating a segfault on the this->contacts vector. The ```Gripper::OnUpdate()``` can run a clear on the vector while the function ```Gripper::OnContacts``` is doing a push_back. 

I've added a mutex to control this actions in  ca173e4.

The good news: I've built a special branch of release-tool to run 100 times the Gripper test. The results are somewhat promising:

* The [jenkins runs](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-debug_gripper-tmp-precise-amd64/) without the patch, failed all the tries: in 9th run for job 5, in the 28th run for job 6, in the 2sd run for job 7.
* The [jenkins runs on nvidia display](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-debug_gripper_mutex-tmp-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/) **with the patch**, all run passed, this means 600 times successfully.

The not so good news: while running some [jenkins job patched without DISPLAY](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-debug_gripper_mutex-tmp-precise-amd64/) and in parallel (more than one jenkins job at a time) I've seen some [of them](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-debug_gripper_mutex-tmp-precise-amd64/12/console) hanging. 

It looks like the pattern was:
```
[ RUN      ] GripperTest.Close
[1;32m[Msg] [0m[1;32mWaiting for master.[0m[1;32m
[0m[1;32m[0m[1;32m[Msg] [0m[1;32mConnected to gazebo master @ [0m[1;32mhttp://127.0.0.1:11345[0m[1;32m
[0m[1;32m[0m[1;32m[Msg] [0m[1;32mPublicized address: [0m[1;32m192.168.1.196[0m[1;32m
[0m[1;32m[0m[1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mRenderEngine.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m665[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mCan't open display: [0m[1;31m[0m[1;31m
[0m[1;33m[Wrn] [0m[1;33m[[0m[1;33mRenderEngine.cc[0m[1;33m:[0m[1;33m88[0m[1;33m] [0m[1;33mUnable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
... hang ....
```
They were not displayed the message of ```ServerFixture load in ...``` so I'm not sure if there is a potential bug in the mutex or the error is elsewhere.
content.html:
Following your investigations, I would say that there is potential risk of generating a segfault on the this->contacts vector. The Gripper::OnUpdate() can run a clear on the vector while the function Gripper::OnContacts is doing a push_back.

I've added a mutex to control this actions in ca173e4.

The good news: I've built a special branch of release-tool to run 100 times the Gripper test. The results are somewhat promising:

  • The jenkins runs without the patch, failed all the tries: in 9th run for job 5, in the 28th run for job 6, in the 2sd run for job 7.
  • The jenkins runs on nvidia display with the patch, all run passed, this means 600 times successfully.

The not so good news: while running some jenkins job patched without DISPLAY and in parallel (more than one jenkins job at a time) I've seen some of them hanging.

It looks like the pattern was:

[ RUN      ] GripperTest.Close
[1;32m[Msg] [0m[1;32mWaiting for master.[0m[1;32m
[0m[1;32m[0m[1;32m[Msg] [0m[1;32mConnected to gazebo master @ [0m[1;32mhttp://127.0.0.1:11345[0m[1;32m
[0m[1;32m[0m[1;32m[Msg] [0m[1;32mPublicized address: [0m[1;32m192.168.1.196[0m[1;32m
[0m[1;32m[0m[1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mRenderEngine.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m665[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mCan't open display: [0m[1;31m[0m[1;31m
[0m[1;33m[Wrn] [0m[1;33m[[0m[1;33mRenderEngine.cc[0m[1;33m:[0m[1;33m88[0m[1;33m] [0m[1;33mUnable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
... hang ....

They were not displayed the message of ServerFixture load in ... so I'm not sure if there is a potential bug in the mutex or the error is elsewhere.

content.raw: [Another hang](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-debug_gripper_mutex-tmp-precise-amd64/18/console). Something is broken. I'm on it.
content.html: Another hang. Something is broken. I'm on it.

content.raw:
After adding some debug messages in  2f95f1a, I found that when a non-ending run occurs, the output is:

```
[1;36m265[Dbg] [0m[1;36m[[0m[1;36mOnContacts Unlock[0m[1;36mServerFixture.cc[0m[1;36m
[0m[1;[1;3636mm:[0m:[0m[1;36m[0m[1;36m[0m[1;36m] [0m[1;36mServerFixture::Unload[0m[1;36m
[0m[1;36m[0m[1;36m[Dbg] [0m[1;36m[[0m[1;36mGripper.cc[0m[1;36m:[0m[1;36m261[0m[1;36m] [0m[1;36mOnContacts Lock[0m[1;36m
[0m[1;36m[0m[1;36m[Dbg] [0m[1;36m[[0m[1;36mGripper.cc[0m[1;36m:[0m[1;36m265[0m[1;36m] [0m[1;36mOnContacts Unlock[0m[1;36m
[0m[1;36m[0m[1;36m[Dbg] [0m[1;36m[[0m[1;36mGripper.cc[0m[1;36m:[0m[1;36m261[0m[1;36m] [0m[1;36mOnContacts Lock[0m[1;36m
[0m[1;36m[0m[1;36m[Dbg] [0m[1;36m[[0m[1;36mGripper.cc[0m[1;36m:[0m[1;36m265[0m[1;36m] [0m[1;36mOnContacts Unlock[0m[1;36m
```
 
The test is not really hanging, at least not the thread that runs the OnContacts function and the ServerFixture is running the Unload method.

content.raw: I still see a fair percentage of test failures of all types in my overnight testing (1-2%) and they are usually happening during `ServerFixture::Unload`. I think those failures can be addressed by a separate pull request.
content.html: I still see a fair percentage of test failures of all types in my overnight testing (1-2%) and they are usually happening during ServerFixture::Unload. I think those failures can be addressed by a separate pull request.
